pr_title: Better decimal support in Scala generators

timeline.message: fix decimal mapping in scala generators
add mapping for decimal, number in scala generators

timeline.bodyText:
Scala has it's own scala.math.BigDecimal type and global alias BigDecimal
https://www.scala-lang.org/api/2.12.0/scala/math/BigDecimal.html
Should we use java type? As those types can be interfered in the client code. Then I will have to write something like this:
import java.math.{ BigDecimal => JBigDecimal }
...
 val income:  BigDecimal  = db.getIncome(..)
 val outcome: JBigDecimal = generatedClient.getOutcome(..)
 val balance: BigDecimal  = income - BigDecimal(outcome)
timeline.author: chameleon82

replies.bodyText:
We can use scala.math.BigDecimal if that's preferable.
I used java.math.BigDecimal in this change as it's copied from another Scala generator.
Let me know what you guys (Scala developers) prefer.
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: scala.math.* BigInt and BigDecimal are preferable types in Scala. No import required for that types.
replies.author: chameleon82
